bunpro.writeup: この is classified as a ' pre-noun adjectival ' in Japanese. These are a special type of word that do not conjugate. This means that they will always appear in the same form. この comes from the same family of words as これ and ここ , and is used to identify a 'thing' that is near the speaker.As the name ' pre-noun adjectival ' suggests, these words will always appear before a noun, and describe that noun in some way.

examples.japanese: このケーキは大きいです。

dojg.description: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
dojg.meaning: The last; this past; this; this coming

examples.japanese: (ksa).秋山さんはこの春結婚します。
examples.english: Miss  Akiyama will marry (this spring / this coming spring).

examples.japanese: (ksb).山下君はこの一週間授業を休んでいます。
examples.english: Yamashita  has been absent from class for the past (one) week.

examples.japanese: (a).この間吉岡さんに会いました。
examples.english: I  met Mr. Yoshioka the other day.

examples.japanese: (b).このたびこの会の会員に加えていただきました。
examples.english: I  became a member of this club at this time.
Shall  we buy a car given this occasion?

examples.japanese: (d).この辺で妥協したらどうですか。
examples.english: Why  don't we compromise now (literally: around this time)?

examples.japanese: (e).この夏は日本の女流作家の研究しています。
examples.english: This  summer I'm doing research on Japanese female writers.

examples.japanese: (f).この一週間は忙しくて何もできないだろう。
examples.english: I'll  be busy this coming week and probably won't be able to do anything (else).

examples.japanese: (g).この次はいつお目にかかれますか。
examples.english: When  could I meet you next?
